data.title: Shortcut key bug when using Simplified Chinese as display language
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

When closing a modified file without saving, the popup dialog use the same shortcut key for '保存' (Save) and '不保存' (Don't Save).

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Change locate to zh-CN
2. Open or create a file
3. Modify the file without saving
4. Close the file from '工作文件' (WORKING FILE) or close the editor directly
5. On the popup saving dialog, '保存' (Save) and '不保存' (Don't Save) use the save shortcut key 'S'

data.title: VSCode should provide an API to allow extensions to launch a debug adapter
data.body:
In order to enable the C# extension to be able to launch the debugger against unit tests, we need to allow the many body of the C# extension to be able to start the debugger, and we need some way to tell the debugger what to do (in our case attach to a specific process).

To solve this, we would like there to be an API exposed to extensions which allows launching the debugger with a specified set of launch option json. Something like:

export function launchDebugger(launchOptions :any) : Thenable<boolean>

data.title: Decorations with gutter icons hide breakpoint icons

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: any

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a decoration type `window.createTextEditorDecorationType({ gutterIconPath: ... });` with an icon, decorate a line.
2. Set a breakpoint for the line. While the breakpoint works, the decoration type gutter icon is completely hiding it.

Ideally, there should be a way to see both (all) icons. I'm assuming the same issue happens if two different extensions set different icons for the same line. Atom and IntelliJ platform based IDEs solve this by allowing to create a plugin specific gutter/or just extending the gutter horizontally to fit all icons.

If the above mentioned solution is not desirable for some reason, then it should probably be allowed to set a gutter icon `zIndex` for a decoration type. Or maybe the breakpoint icon should just take precedence and always be displayed above any extensions icons.

data.title: Debug controls does not appear if Go compilation fails while debugging
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.1.0-insider - OS Version: Mac OSX 10.11.4 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install Go 2. Install the vscode-go extension 3. Install the Go debugger 4. Create a new folder with hello.go that doesn't compile ``` package main func main() { blah } ``` 1. Go to the debug tab and run debug. 2. The debug console will tell you there's a compile problem. There's a running horizontal blue line below the debug menu, which seem to show that the debug process is still going on. But since I can't stop the debugger, so the only thing I can do is close and reopen the project. This bug only happened in the lastest Insiders build. Debugging worked fine in the previous version of insiders and in the stable 1.0.0 build, so I thought this bug is best posted here. I haven't tried vscode with anything other than go, so I'm not sure if it's just a language specific issue. In the previous Insiders and stable versions, a compile failure will show a debug console, and the debugger controls at the top of the screen, with the option to stop the debugger.

data.title: Bower JSON completion not suggesting versions
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Mac

Regarding test item #5753
Just found this issue a day after I did my testing.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In a bower.json file, type in a package in the dependency section (I used lodash as the package).  It will auto-complete and give you `"lodash":"latest"`
2. Try changing `latest` to something else, like `^1.0.0`
3. Note that it does not give you a suggestion like it would in a package.json file.

Angular 2 uses brackets around attributes or \* prefixes, which break syntax highlighting and IntelliSense: ``` html
``` ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10532611/14869187/2cd876b8-0cd2-11e6-9284-076cf584a592.png)

data.title: [json] Commas are inconsistently added to JSON completion
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Mac

Steps to Reproduce:

Regarding test plan #5753
Just found this very small bug (not an urgent one—ok to delay if necessary).
1. Type just a package name in bower.json with no leading quotation mark (so it autocompletes the quotes for you)
2. Now try adding a package _with_ a leading quotation mark.

Note that in the first case a comma is not added, but in the second case a comma is added.  Not a huge deal, but consistency would be nice.

Preferably, if it knows that it's on the last line of properties (i.e. the next line is a closing brace), then it would not insert a comma.  But if it's in the middle of the list (i.e. the next line is another property in the JSON), then it would add a comma.

data.title: Debugging with smartstep is super slow.
data.body:
Testing: #4954
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create Basic nodejs JavaScript express3 project from Visual studio. 
2. Launch VS code and open project folder.
3. update launch.json and set the value for smartstep:"true" and sourcemap: "true"
5. Start debugging and verify application behavior.

Note: I tried with all the possible combination of smartstep and sourcemap and observed this behavior when both the properties set to true. 

Actual: Debugging is super slow and taking long time to render page. 
Expected: Debugging should not be slow down when user enable smartstep.
![smartstepdebugissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14865846/98fd198c-0c75-11e6-9d0a-53ecb5785314.gif)

- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a bunch of files in the editor
2. Leave it running for a long period of time (over 8 hours)
3. Editor becomes unresponsive and needs to be restarted

I think it's actually a fairly common scenario to leave the editor running in the background and leave the office for more than 8 hours :)

data.title: Some key bindings conflict with those of the window manager
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, Cinnamon desktop environment

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Open more than one files on the side (so that the editor ends up with multiple columns)
2.  Try using Ctrl+Alt+Shift+<Left/Right> to switch between editors

Expected behavior:
Editors are switched

Observed behavior:
Cinnamon intercepts the shortcut and switches workspaces instead

Is it possible to configure the editor's key bindings manually?

data.title: Provide a way to dismiss the COMPARE message without comparing files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.15-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10.0.10586

My example is related to the package.json file. 
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open package.json and make a change but don't save
2. Install new node packages
3. Note the opened file does not update with the new changes, attempt to save

Note there will be a prompt that says changes on disk are newer than the open file and give you the ability to compare the two. But what if the user is not interested in comparing and simply wants to close the file without saving. While closing the file without saving is possible there seems to be no way to dismiss the "compare" prompt without clicking the compare button. 

See image: ![vscode-insider-compare-message](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1466812/14859796/640eed2c-0c6b-11e6-9b65-21b8e26ead03.png)

It would be nice to have a way to dismiss this message without having to go into compare mode.
